result.execSummary:
The defendant Tony Lee Bowman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Arm Self w/ Dangerous Weapon [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(2)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

AMENDED 11-13-2020 Following Probation Review Hearing:  Court ordered probation extended for 6 months and as condition of probation, pay $100.00 per month 12/01/2020 towards unpaid court costs.  New discharge 7/25/2021.  Court will discharge earlier if court obligations paid before 7/25/2021.  If all our ordered obligations are not paid in full by 7/10/2021, report to the Pepin County Jail on 7/10/2021 at 8:00 a.m. to serve 10 days.
Concurrent with: Pepin County Case No. 2015CF46

timeConds.notes:
90 days in the Pepin County Jail with credit for 95 days served which include 28 days of in-patient treatment.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Tony Lee Bowman

records.addlTxt: DOC - Notice of Case Status Change Slip - Discharge

Discharge Certificate.   Effective July 25, 2021, discharged absolutely.
Civil rights restored:  1)Right to Vote.  2)Obligations for jury duty.
Civil rights not restored:  1)Firearms may not be used or possessed unless a pardon, which does not restrict possession of firearms, is received from the governer.  2)Public office can not be held unless a pardon is obtained from the governor.
Correspondence from Tony Bowman.  Court's reponse.

09:29 AM Defendant Tony Lee Bowman appeared by phone means.  Mr. Bowman doesn't expect to his attorney to appear this morning as has not heard from her for 5 years.  Court informs Mr. Bowman has unpaid court ordered obligations and asks if Mr. Bowman prefers to pay the obligations or have probation extended.  Mr. Bowman has been working but is off work currently but would try to pay it off by January 25, 2021.  Court orders 6 month extension and as condition of probation pay $100/mo. com. 12/1/20 towards court costs.  New discharge 7/25/21.  We will discharge you earlier if court obligations paid before 7/25/21.  If by 7/10/21 court obligations are not paid in full, report to jail on 7/10 at 8:00 a.m. for 10 days.
Probation review hearing on November 16, 2020 at 09:30 am.
DOC - Notice of CO Financial Obligation Owing

Counts 2, 3, 4 DRI

Defendant Tony Lee Bowman in court with attorney Kathleen R. Avoles.  Defendant Tony Lee Bowman in custody.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Judge advises defendant of charges/max penalties of Count 1 in 15CF31, and confirms defendant waives right to PH in 15CF46 and binds defendant over.  State files Information.  Court advised defendant of charge/max. penalties and constitutional rights, felony prohibitions.  Defendant enters plea of no contest to Count 1 in 15CF31 and no contest to bail jumping in 15CF46.  Plea colloquy. Court finds defendant's waiver of his constitutional rights and pleas done knowingly & voluntarily, accepts pleas and finds defendant guilty, order PSI, bond remain as previously set with surety released from bond. DRI counts 2,3,4 in 15CF31.

Defendant Tony Lee Bowman in court with attorney Kathleen R. Avoles.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Counsel informs court of agreement.  Defendant will waive PH in 15CF46, will plead to burglary & bail jumping and request PSI.  State moves to dismiss motion to forfeit bond.
Sentencing hearing at 01-25-2016 02:00 pm
From June 30, 2015 proceedings

Status conference at 11-16-2015 11:00 am.
Motion hearing at 11-16-2015 11:00 am.

Defendant Tony Lee Bowman in court with attorney Kathleen R. Avoles.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court advises defendant of charges as stated in the Information, maximum penalties, felony prohibitions, and advises defendant of constitutional rights.  Defendant pleads not guilty.  Pending motion to revoke bond to be addressed at next hearing.  Atty Avoles requests reduction of $5000 cash bond to $500 cash bond; defendant on strict conditions in Eau Claire County.  State objects and notes the safest and best place for Mr. Bowman and the public is locked up.  Court orders bond remain as set for now.  Referred to scheduling clerk to set STC.

Arraignment at 10-05-2015 04:00 pm.
Motion hearing at 10-05-2015 04:00 pm.

Defendant Tony Lee Bowman in court with attorney Kathleen R. Avoles.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State requests $5000 cash bond in 15CF46.  State filed a motion to revoke surety forfeit bond in 15CF31.  Atty Avoles requests the surety bond from initial case be carried over to new case as well; his Eau Claire case has addt'l safeguards, no need for cash bond, suggest we revisit it when we visit the motion to revoke bond on the other case.  Court imposes $5000 cash bond on both cases, surety no longer liable.  Court will address the motion for judgment against surety at the next hearing.  Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing in 15CF31.  Court handed WOPH form and reviewed.  Court finds defendant knowingly & voluntarily waives PH, bind you over for trial; instruct the DA to file an Information within 30 days and ask counsel to see scheduling clerk for arraignment.  Schedule MH and cont'd INIT on new case at the same time.
Motion to Forfeit Bond
Adjourned initial appearance at 09-28-2015 11:00 am
Cont'd.

Atty Avoles requests to address bond, modify to ask the curfew be extended to allow AA meetings with sponsor.  No objection by State.  Court broadens request and eliminates the curfew, all other conditions remains the same.  Referred to scheduling clerk.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: Court approves surety bond with defendant's father, Paul Bowman, as surety and with the following conditions:  Defendant to reside with his parents at 3328 Oakland Street, Eau Claire, WI 54703 and with curfew from 10 p.m. - 6 a.m. in their home and obey household rules; no contact with co-defendants, Jordan Callan, Saige Weiss, Stephen McDew, Anthony Goviera; No possession or consumption of alcohol; No possession of controlled substance; No entry into bars or taverns; No possession of firearm; No violations of law.
Cash bond or surety bond.

Defendant Tony Lee Bowman in court with attorney Kathleen R. Avoles.  Defendant in custody.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Avoles informs the court she filed a motion for bond modification.  She requests bond be converted to signature or surety bond, his parents present in courtroom.  State objects to bond modification.  Court explains surety bond and questions defendant's father.  Court approves surety bond with defendant's father, Paul Bowman, as surety and with the following conditions:  Defendant to reside with his parents with curfew from 10 p.m. - 6 a.m. in her home and obey household rules; no contact with co-defendants; No possession or consumption of alcohol; No possession of controlled substance; No entry into bars or taverns; No possession of firearm; No violations of law.  Defendant waives time limits for P.H.  Referred to scheduling clerk for cont'd INIT.
Motion for Reduction of Bond and Notice of Motion

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: Defendant Tony Lee Bowman in court, in custody.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court confirms defendant received copy of criminal complaint.  Court advises defendant of charges/max. penalties, constitutional rights, felony conviction prohibitions and right to preliminary hearing.   State requests $5000 cash bond on all defendants with conditions:  no possession of firearm; no possession or consumption of alcohol or entry in bars or taverns.  Court sets bond at $5000 cash with conditions: no contact with co-defendants; no possession of firearms; no possession or consumption of alcohol; no entry into bars or taverns; no other violations of law.  Defendant agrees to continue matter to contact an attorney.  Court notes waiver of time limits of P.H. which can be reasserted at any time.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for June 30, 2015 at 10:00 am.
